LOOKING AHEAD
Food and Beer – A Food Truck Rally & Pop-up Biergarten takes place from 3-9 p.m. Feb.1-2 and noon-9 p.m. Feb. 3 at Riverside Park. The event is hosted by the Bonita Springs Historical Society. 10451 Old 41 Road, Bonita Springs. $28 or $49 VIP at www.eventbrite.com.
The Ultimate Car Show – The Naples Automotive Experience kicks off with a Jetport Reception from 6-10 p.m. Feb. 1, followed by events at various locations Feb. 2-4. Shelby American reveals the new Shelby Series 2 car, plus exotic cars, jets, planes, helicopters and more are showcased. There’s also a cigar lounge, fine wine tasting, food and music. Reservations required. www.naplesautomotiveexperience.org.
Elvis in Town – World champion tribute artist Ted Torres Martin’s portrayal of The King of Rock N’ Roll is on stage at 6:30 p.m. Feb. 1 at the Rose History Auditorium. He’s called one of the world’s top tributes — a title he earned in Memphis from Elvis Presley Enterprises. Doors open at 6 p.m. $50. 180 S. Heathwood Dr., Marco Island. themihs.org or 239-389-6447.
Al Fresco Concert – Mercato Nights Music Series continues from 6:30-8:30 p.m. Feb. 1 with a performance by Cayman on the event lawn at Mercato. Food and drinks for purchase from the Zza Baby food truck and The Pubs outdoor bar. BYO lawn chairs and blankets. Leashed pets welcomed. 9110 Strada Place, Naples. 239-254-1080 or experiencemercato.com.
Classic Film Screening – Naples Cinematheque presents an outdoor showing of “Trainspotting” from 7-9 p.m. Feb. 1 at The Burrow. The new restoration allows viewers to see all the debauchery in crystal clear color. 1780 Commercial Dr., Naples. $12. www.naplescinematheque.com/events.
Bonita Concert – R Howard and The Incorrigibles present “Total Rock ‘N’ Roll Recall” at 7:30 p.m. Feb. 1 in the Moe Auditorium at Arts Bonita. The show features three well-respected local musicians: Darrell Nutt on drums, Susie Hulcher on bass and vocals, and Ricky Howard on guitar and vocals, joined by the special guest artist Matt Baxley on keyboards and vocals. $35 and $45. 10150 Bonita Beach Road, Bonita Springs. 239-495-8989 or www.artcenterbonita.org.
Seafood Fest – The 2024 Everglades Seafood Festival marks its 54th year Feb. 2-4 in Everglades City. It’s three days of live country music, carnival rides, arts, crafts and seafood. Headliner Lonestar performs at 8 p.m. Saturday. 102 Copeland Ave. N., Everglades City. evergladesseafoodfestival.org/.
Weekend Unwind – The Estero Historical Society hosts a “First Friday on the Deck” from 4-6 p.m. Feb. 2 at its headquarters. This flavored Vodka Tasting Fundraiser features four flavored vodkas paired with appetizers in a natural environment. $25 members; $30 non-members. 9285 Corkscrew Palms Blvd., Estero. RSVP required at EsteroHistoricalSociety.com or 239-272-1911.
Opera Event – “A Toast To Opera: Madama Butterfly” takes place at 4 p.m. Feb. 2 at the Naples Botanical Garden. This is a special opportunity to learn about the opera before it’s performed by the Naples Opera in March. Dr. Tom Cimarusti, Florida Gulf Coast University Professor of Musicology, speaks and answers questions. Wine and light bites follow. $38. Student tickets with ID are available through the box office only. 239-963-9050 or https:// operanaples.org.
Evening in the Garden – The Naples Garden’s Friday After 5 from 5-7 p.m. Feb. 2 features the Naples Opera resident artists performing select arias from “Madama Butterfly” and other well-known works. The Naples Philharmonic Youth Jazz Orchestra also performs, and the Fogg Café stays open with a full menu and bar. 4820 Bayshore Dr., Naples. www.naplesgarden.org or 239-643-7275.
Tribute Show – The Legends Concert Series continues from 6-10 p.m. Feb. 2 with a tribute concert performance of The Cars and Journey on the East Lawn at Paradise Coast Sports Complex. Tickets: $40; $75 platinum and $125 VIP includes two drink tickets and one food ticket. Food and drink for purchase. 3940 City Gate Blvd. N., Naples. 239-252-4386 or https:// playparadisecoast.com. ¦
 

Music Lecture – “Tracking Rhythms” is the subject of Terry Wolkowicz lecture at 10 a.m. in the Rowe Center at Artis—Naples. Explore the concept of rhythmic motion through analysis of quadruped track patterns and gaits and hear these same gaits illustrated through classical music pieces by Bach, Dvorák, Schumann, Debussy and Strauss. This presentation is part of Terry Wolkowicz’s Classical Music and Our Natural World series by Artis—Naples Lifelong Learning. 5833 Pelican Bay Blvd., Naples. artisnaples.org.
Nature Chat – Naples Botanical Garden offers Dig Deeper at 11:30 a.m. and 1 p.m. daily. Take a little thyme to become a garden sage. That’s a gardening joke. Hear more when you join garden staff for a chat about a different topic every day — like using adaptive tools, repotting orchids or propagating succulents. Free with garden admission. 4820 Bayshore Dr., Naples. www.naplesgarden.org or 239-643-7275.
Love Chess? – Adults and teens are invited to sharpen their chess skills with practice games at 2 p.m. at the Bonita Springs Public Library. The library supplies the boards. 10560 Reynolds St., Bonita Springs. 239-479-4636 or www.leelibrary.net.
Live Music – Sol Real performs from 6-9 p.m. at The Center Bar at the Promenade at Bonita Bay. 26811 S. Bay Dr., Bonita Springs. Free. www.thecenterbar.com.

Ethnic Tribal Exercise meets at 9:30 a.m. Tuesdays and Thursdays. Cha-Cha/ Rumba/ Swing Group Class meets at 6 p.m. Wednesdays. $10 per class. 26821 S. Bay Dr., #110, Bonita Springs. 239-908-9492 or promenadeshops.com/directory/ enchanted-ballroom/.

Food and drink for purchase. 3940 City Gate Blvd. N., Naples. 239-252-4386 or https:// playparadisecoast.com. ¦
 

Nature Chat – Naples Botanical Garden offers Dig Deeper at 11:30 a.m. and 1 p.m. daily. Take a little thyme to become a garden sage. That’s a gardening joke. Hear more when you join garden staff for a chat about a different topic every day — like using adaptive tools, repotting orchids or propagating succulents. Free with garden admission. 4820 Bayshore Dr., Naples. www.naplesgarden.org or 239-643-7275.
Love Chess? – Adults and teens are invited to sharpen their chess skills with practice games at 2 p.m. at the Bonita Springs Public Library. The library supplies the boards. 10560 Reynolds St., Bonita Springs. 239-479-4636 or www.leelibrary.net.
Live Music – Sol Real performs from 6-9 p.m. at The Center Bar at the Promenade at Bonita Bay. 26811 S. Bay Dr., Bonita Springs. Free. www.thecenterbar.com.
Open Dance Classes – Enchanted Ballroom at the Promenade offers drop-in group classes in a variety of forms of dance, with no partner needed. Styling Dance Class (intermediate and advanced levels) meets at 6 p.m. Thursdays. Night Club Latin (beginner friendly) meets at 6 p.m. Friday. Ethnic Tribal Exercise meets at 9:30 a.m. Tuesdays and Thursdays. Cha-Cha/ Rumba/ Swing Group Class meets at 6 p.m. Wednesdays. $10 per class. 26821 S. Bay Dr., #110, Bonita Springs. 239-908-9492 or promenadeshops.com/directory/ enchanted-ballroom/.
Special event – The 20th anniversary celebration and fundraiser “Off The Walls!” take place from 6-9 p.m. at the Performing Art Center. Arts Bonita’s signature fundraising event supports scholarships and youth programs. This showcase of art and collectibles features random drawings for artworks, cuisine adventures, décor and luxury items. A catered hors d’oeuvres buffet, wine and beer, and a decadent dessert bar. Live entertainment. $200 single tickets; $325 couples. 10150 Bonita Beach Road, Bonita Springs. artcenterbonita.org or 239-495-8989.

The concert features Scott Coulter, vocalist, Jessica Hendy, vocalist, John Boswell, piano and vocalist and Paul Shewchuk, bass. Hear the biggest songs from the biggest musicals from stage and screen. 5833 Pelican Bay Blvd., Naples. artisnaples.org.

Rubino & Rimi – It’s an Italian & Stallion Comedy Special with Fred Rubino & Carl Rimi at 7 p.m. at Off the Hook Comedy Club. Fred Rubino is a standup comic from Brooklyn who performs all over the East Coast and Carl Rimi is a seasoned stand-up comedian with a remarkable 28-year career. This is a two-fer of Italian comedians. $24; $35 VIP; or get a VIP suite for 5 people for $250. 2500 Vanderbilt Beach Road. 239- 389-6901 or www.offthehookcomedy.com.
Italian Opera – The Gulfshore Opera presents “A Night In Italy” at 7 p.m. at the St. Leo’s Parish Life Center. Experience an all-Italian evening of opera with arias, ensembles, Canzone Napoletana, and popular songs performed by Gulfshore Opera’s professional artists-in-residence. $40 or $55 for premium tickets, which include front center seating and a meet-the-artists reception following the concert. 28290 Beaumont Road, Bonita Springs. 239-529-3925 or https:// gulfshoreopera.org/.

FRIDAY1.26
Love Wine? – The Naples Winter Wine Festival takes place today-Sunday at The Ritz-Carlton Golf Resort. This high-end wine event features live and virtual auctions, taskings, dinners, luncheons and a celebration brunch. Tickets are sold for the entire Festival only. Proceeds from the Festival benefit the Naples Children & Education Foundation. 2600 Tiburon Blvd., Naples. 239-514-2239 or email Lisa Juliano at lisa@napleswinefestival.com.
Shelling Time – Life’s a Beach Barrier Island Shelling is offered from 9 a.m.-noon Friday-Tuesday and 1 p.m. Wednesday at Rookery Bay. Join this shell-search adventure. $99. Reservations required. 300 Tower Road, Naples. www.RookeryBay.org.
Collier County Chat – Garden Side Chickee Chat, the first of three, takes place from 11 a.m.-noon at the Historic Palm Cottage. Crystal Kinzel, Clerk of the Circuit Court and Comptroller for Collier County, speaks about the future of Collier County and answers questions. $8, member discount. Also meets Feb. 23 and March 29. at 137 12th Ave. S., Naples. www.NaplesHistoricalSociety.org or 239-261-8164.
Don’t Miss – A Pre-owned Jewelry Sale takes place from noon-6:30 p.m. today and 8:30 a.m.-3 p.m. Saturday at the Estero Historical Society. From 4-6:30 p.m. today and 8:30 a.m.-noon Saturday, Rick Gannon of Gannon’s Antiques and Art Center appraises jewelry. Each guest can have three items appraised with a donation of $20 per item to the EHS. Members save $5. 9285 Corkscrew Palms Blvd., Estero. Online registration is required for appraisals at https:// esterohistoricalsociety.com.
Kayaks and Birds – Sunset Birding Kayak Tour takes place from 4:15-6:15 p.m. today, Sunday, Monday and Wednesday, at Rookery Bay. Maybe the best way to see birds. $75 single; $140 or $150 tandem. Reservations required. 300 Tower Road, Naples. www.RookeryBay.org.
Lavell Crawford – Comedian and actor Lavell Crawford performs at 6:30 and 8:30 p.m. today, 6 and 8 p.m. Saturday and 6:30 p.m. Sunday at Off the Hook Comedy Club. He’s a man who needs no introduction. $30; $40 VIP. 2500 Vanderbilt Beach Road. 239-389-6901 or www.offthehookcomedy.com.

SATURDAY1.27
Bargains Here – The Naples Women’s Club’s annual Flea Market takes place from 9 a.m.-2 p.m. at the Naples Woman’s Clubhouse. The sale features countless items including clothing, housewares, electronics and toys. 570 Park St., Naples. 631-997-3632 or napleswomansclub.org.
Garden Painters – The Plein Air Fest takes place from 9 a.m.-5 p.m. at Naples Botanical Garden. Dozens of artists work in the garden painting en plein air. Take part in art-themed activities and tours. $25 adults, $10 age 4-17, free for members and younger than 4. 4820 Bayshore Dr., Naples. www.naplesgarden.org or 239-643-7275.
Doll Show – The Naples Doll Club hosts its annual Doll Show & Sale from 9 a.m.- 3 p.m. at Moorings Presbyterian Church. Find dolls from vintage and antique to modern, plus teddy bears, miniatures and doll clothes. A silent auction and raffle are also planned, and the Doll Doctor sees dolls needing repairs. 791 Harbour Dr., Naples. Free parking. $6 adults; free for younger than 10. 239-571-5082.
Vets Group – Gulf Coast Veterans & Friends meets for coffee, doughnuts, fellowship and stories at 10 a.m. on Saturdays at the Fleischmann Park Community Center. Veterans from World War II, Korea and Vietnam are welcomed. 1600 Fleischmann Blvd., Naples. 239-289-6952 or info@gulfcoastvf.org.
Car Show – West Coast Muscle Car Club’s 20th annual Car and Truck Show takes place at the North Collier Regional Park. See over 300 new and vintage cars and trucks on display, plus vendors, music and food trucks. Free parking and shuttle services. $15; free for age 12 and younger. Proceeds benefit local charities including the Avow Kids program, which supports children ages 5-17 who are experiencing grief or loss www.avowcares.org/wcmccshow or www.westcoastmusclecarclub.com.
Crafts and Cook-off – The Sunshine State Steak Cook-Off with Arts & Crafts Festival takes place from 10 a.m.-4 p.m. at Ave Maria Catholic Parish Church. The Sunshine State Steak Cook-Off, which claims to be the largest steak competition east of the Mississippi, runs from 2-6:30 p.m. Live music, a bounce house for kids. Proceeds from the Steak Cook-Off benefit local charities supported by the Knights of Columbus. 5088 Annunciation Cir., Ave Maria. avemariakofc.org/2024-sunshine state-steak-cook-off-tickets.
Arty Affair – The Mercato Art Celebration 2024 takes place from 10 a.m.-6 p.m. today and 9 a.m.-3 p.m. Sunday at Mercato. This two-day celebration of art on Strada hosted by Naples Picasso Events brings out the crowds to see artists, enjoy restaurant specials or grab a cocktail. Free. 9110 Strada Place, Naples. experiencemercato.com/events/mercato-art-celebration/.
Car Lovers – A weekly Car Cruise-In hosted by the Marco Island Corvette and Muscle Car Club takes place from 10 a.m.- 1 p.m. Saturdays in the Marco Island Lutheran Church parking lot. 525 N. Collier Blvd., Marco Island. www.marcoislandcorvettes.com.
Historic Event – The second annual Venezia Renaissance Faire returns for its final weekend from 10:30 a.m.-5 p.m. today and Sunday adjacent to the Bonita Springs Poker Room. Immerse yourself in the magic of the Renaissance era through entertainment like fire-eaters, acrobats and magicians, art and history. Tickets start at $20 online in advance; $23 at the gate. 28001 Old 41 Road, Bonita Springs. https:// events.veneziarenaissancefaire.com/.
Artisan Market – Mercato hosts a Hand & Harvest Artisan Market, holiday edition, from noon-4 p.m. in Ste. 3135, across from Z Gallerie & Tommy Bahama. Kids can take photos with Santa while parents shop 35+ local artisans selling a curated collection of handmade items from baked goods to fine art. Bubbles Bar offers mimosas benefiting Empty Bowls Naples. 9110 Strada Place, Naples. 239-254-1080 or experiencemercato.com.
Hey Kids – Live! Science Shows are hosted by the staff at Stemlab at 1:30 p.m. on Saturdays and Sundays at Miromar Outlets, Ste. 192, near WINK Playland. Get lessons on chemistry, aerodynamics and fire. 10801 Corkscrew Road, Estero. 239-948-3766 or www.miromaroutlets.com.
Live Music – Live at the Cove rocks the Cove Beer & Wine Bar at Paradise Coast Sports Complex from 5-8 p.m. with live music by the Geezers in Paradise and food and drink specials. 3940 City Gate Blvd. N., Naples. 239-252-4386 or playparadisecoast.com.

The buffet menu includes chicken paprikash with spaetzle and chef-carved prime rib with dobos torte for dessert. There’s music by Talfi. 3855 Forest Glen Blvd., Naples. Reservations are required by Jan. 19 at 239-821-1814.

Garden Tour – Take an Organic Garden Tour from 10-11 a.m. Tuesdays at Shangri La Springs. Tours are led by Cecelia Morales, the organic garden manager, and include a sensory-based walking tour around the garden’s subtropical, tropical, annual and perennial crops and orchard. Register in advance. $15 per person. Closed-toe shoes, a hat, sunglasses and sunscreen, and a full water bottle are recommended. 27750 Old 41 Road, Bonita Springs. 239-949-0749 or www.ShangriLaSprings.com.

One-hour narrated tours of Ave Maria, Collier County’s ‘Community of the Year,’ showcase the town and its history. After the tour, view 25+ model homes by premier builders. Free and it includes a trolley bag filled with swag. No reservations required. 239-352-3903 or visit AveMaria.com.

WEDNESDAY1.31
Guided Tours – The Naples Historical Society’s Official Walking Tours of the Naples Historic District have resumed and are offered on select Wednesdays at 9:30 a.m. The 90-minute docent-led tours take guests through the residential neighborhood of beautifully maintained private historic homes, all of which embody unique stories of Naples’ past. Tours begin and end at Historic Palm Cottage at 137 12th Ave. S., Naples. $16 members; $22 non-members. Reservations required. 888-472-1895 or napleshistoricalsociety.org.
Learn Bridge – Bridge declarer play lessons are offered from 9 a.m.-noon Wednesdays at Elks Lodge No. 2010. No partner needed. 11250 Tamiami Trail E., Naples. Register at 239-775-8460 with Marcia.
Chair Yoga – Chair Yoga classes are offered from 1-2 p.m. Wednesdays at the Fleischmann Community Center. A gentle practice of stretching and centering poses done on or next to a chair. 1600 Fleischmann Blvd., Naples. An online chair yoga class is offered from 11 a.m.-noon on Tuesdays. Led by Jean Erlbaum, certified master yoga teacher. 413-230-1518 or jean.erlbaum@verizon.net.

Tickets: $49. Reservations required. 10150 Bonita Beach Road, Bonita Springs. 239-495-8989 or www.artcenterbonita.org.

LOOKING AHEAD
Food and Beer – A Food Truck Rally & Pop-up Biergarten takes place from 3-9 p.m. Feb.1-2 and noon-9 p.m. Feb. 3 at Riverside Park. The event is hosted by the Bonita Springs Historical Society. 10451 Old 41 Road, Bonita Springs. $28 or $49 VIP at www.eventbrite.com.
The Ultimate Car Show – The Naples Automotive Experience kicks off with a Jetport Reception from 6-10 p.m. Feb. 1, followed by events at various locations Feb. 2-4. Shelby American reveals the new Shelby Series 2 car, plus exotic cars, jets, planes, helicopters and more are showcased. There’s also a cigar lounge, fine wine tasting, food and music. Reservations required. www.naplesautomotiveexperience.org.
Elvis in Town – World champion tribute artist Ted Torres Martin’s portrayal of The King of Rock N’ Roll is on stage at 6:30 p.m. Feb. 1 at the Rose History Auditorium. He’s called one of the world’s top tributes — a title he earned in Memphis from Elvis Presley Enterprises. Doors open at 6 p.m. $50. 180 S. Heathwood Dr., Marco Island. themihs.org or 239-389-6447.
Al Fresco Concert – Mercato Nights Music Series continues from 6:30-8:30 p.m. Feb. 1 with a performance by Cayman on the event lawn at Mercato. Food and drinks for purchase from the Zza Baby food truck and The Pubs outdoor bar. BYO lawn chairs and blankets. Leashed pets welcomed. 9110 Strada Place, Naples. 239-254-1080 or experiencemercato.com.
Classic Film Screening – Naples Cinematheque presents an outdoor showing of “Trainspotting” from 7-9 p.m. Feb. 1 at The Burrow. The new restoration allows viewers to see all the debauchery in crystal clear color. 1780 Commercial Dr., Naples. $12. www.naplescinematheque.com/events.
Bonita Concert – R Howard and The Incorrigibles present “Total Rock ‘N’ Roll Recall” at 7:30 p.m. Feb. 1 in the Moe Auditorium at Arts Bonita. The show features three well-respected local musicians: Darrell Nutt on drums, Susie Hulcher on bass and vocals, and Ricky Howard on guitar and vocals, joined by the special guest artist Matt Baxley on keyboards and vocals. $35 and $45. 10150 Bonita Beach Road, Bonita Springs. 239-495-8989 or www.artcenterbonita.org.
Seafood Fest – The 2024 Everglades Seafood Festival marks its 54th year Feb. 2-4 in Everglades City. It’s three days of live country music, carnival rides, arts, crafts and seafood. Headliner Lonestar performs at 8 p.m. Saturday. 102 Copeland Ave. N., Everglades City. evergladesseafoodfestival.org/.
Weekend Unwind – The Estero Historical Society hosts a “First Friday on the Deck” from 4-6 p.m. Feb. 2 at its headquarters. This flavored Vodka Tasting Fundraiser features four flavored vodkas paired with appetizers in a natural environment. $25 members; $30 non-members. 9285 Corkscrew Palms Blvd., Estero. RSVP required at EsteroHistoricalSociety.com or 239-272-1911.
Opera Event – “A Toast To Opera: Madama Butterfly” takes place at 4 p.m. Feb. 2 at the Naples Botanical Garden. This is a special opportunity to learn about the opera before it’s performed by the Naples Opera in March. Dr. Tom Cimarusti, Florida Gulf Coast University Professor of Musicology, speaks and answers questions. Wine and light bites follow. $38. Student tickets with ID are available through the box office only. 239-963-9050 or https:// operanaples.org.
Evening in the Garden – The Naples Garden’s Friday After 5 from 5-7 p.m. Feb. 2 features the Naples Opera resident artists performing select arias from “Madama Butterfly” and other well-known works. The Naples Philharmonic Youth Jazz Orchestra also performs, and the Fogg Café stays open with a full menu and bar. 4820 Bayshore Dr., Naples. www.naplesgarden.org or 239-643-7275.

Open Dance Classes – Enchanted Ballroom at the Promenade offers drop-in group classes in a variety of forms of dance, with no partner needed. Styling Dance Class (intermediate and advanced levels) meets at 6 p.m. Thursdays. Night Club Latin (beginner friendly) meets at 6 p.m. Friday. Ethnic Tribal Exercise meets at 9:30 a.m. Tuesdays and Thursdays. Cha-Cha/ Rumba/ Swing Group Class meets at 6 p.m. Wednesdays. $10 per class. 26821 S. Bay Dr., #110, Bonita Springs. 239-908-9492 or promenadeshops.com/directory/ enchanted-ballroom/.
Special event – The 20th anniversary celebration and fundraiser “Off The Walls!” take place from 6-9 p.m. at the Performing Art Center. Arts Bonita’s signature fundraising event supports scholarships and youth programs. This showcase of art and collectibles features random drawings for artworks, cuisine adventures, décor and luxury items. A catered hors d’oeuvres buffet, wine and beer, and a decadent dessert bar. Live entertainment. $200 single tickets; $325 couples. 10150 Bonita Beach Road, Bonita Springs. artcenterbonita.org or 239-495-8989.
Songbook Concert – The Broadway Hollywood Songbook is on the program at 6 and 8:30 p.m. at Daniels Pavilion at Artis—Naples. The concert features Scott Coulter, vocalist, Jessica Hendy, vocalist, John Boswell, piano and vocalist and Paul Shewchuk, bass. Hear the biggest songs from the biggest musicals from stage and screen. 5833 Pelican Bay Blvd., Naples. artisnaples.org.
The Zig Zag – Simply Fi performs from 6-10 p.m. at the Zig Zag Lounge at Seminole Casino Hotel Immokalee. 506 S. First St., Immokalee. 800-218-0007, moreinparadise.com or facebook.com/SeminoleCasinoHotel/.
Singers Sought – Join the Paradise Coastmen Barbershop Chorus at rehearsal at 6:30 p.m. Thursdays at Our Savior Lutheran Church. Singers are wanted or just come to listen. 1955 Curling Ave., Naples. 239-362-6366 or www.ParadiseCoastmen.org.
Rubino & Rimi – It’s an Italian & Stallion Comedy Special with Fred Rubino & Carl Rimi at 7 p.m. at Off the Hook Comedy Club. Fred Rubino is a standup comic from Brooklyn who performs all over the East Coast and Carl Rimi is a seasoned stand-up comedian with a remarkable 28-year career. This is a two-fer of Italian comedians. $24; $35 VIP; or get a VIP suite for 5 people for $250. 2500 Vanderbilt Beach Road. 239- 389-6901 or www.offthehookcomedy.com.
Italian Opera – The Gulfshore Opera presents “A Night In Italy” at 7 p.m. at the St. Leo’s Parish Life Center. Experience an all-Italian evening of opera with arias, ensembles, Canzone Napoletana, and popular songs performed by Gulfshore Opera’s professional artists-in-residence. $40 or $55 for premium tickets, which include front center seating and a meet-the-artists reception following the concert. 28290 Beaumont Road, Bonita Springs. 239-529-3925 or https:// gulfshoreopera.org/.
At The Stage – The Stage presents the Alter Eagles tribute band at 7:30 p.m. One of the most requested acts, this show is likely to sell out. Dinner seating from 5:30-7 p.m. Reservations. 9144 Bonita Beach Road, Bonita Springs. 239-405-8566 or www.stagebonita.com.
FRIDAY1.26
Love Wine? – The Naples Winter Wine Festival takes place today-Sunday at The Ritz-Carlton Golf Resort. This high-end wine event features live and virtual auctions, taskings, dinners, luncheons and a celebration brunch. Tickets are sold for the entire Festival only. Proceeds from the Festival benefit the Naples Children & Education Foundation. 2600 Tiburon Blvd., Naples. 239-514-2239 or email Lisa Juliano at lisa@napleswinefestival.com.
Shelling Time – Life’s a Beach Barrier Island Shelling is offered from 9 a.m.-noon Friday-Tuesday and 1 p.m. Wednesday at Rookery Bay. Join this shell-search adventure. $99. Reservations required. 300 Tower Road, Naples. www.RookeryBay.org.
Collier County Chat – Garden Side Chickee Chat, the first of three, takes place from 11 a.m.-noon at the Historic Palm Cottage. Crystal Kinzel, Clerk of the Circuit Court and Comptroller for Collier County, speaks about the future of Collier County and answers questions. $8, member discount. Also meets Feb. 23 and March 29. at 137 12th Ave. S., Naples. www.NaplesHistoricalSociety.org or 239-261-8164.
Don’t Miss – A Pre-owned Jewelry Sale takes place from noon-6:30 p.m. today and 8:30 a.m.-3 p.m. Saturday at the Estero Historical Society. From 4-6:30 p.m. today and 8:30 a.m.-noon Saturday, Rick Gannon of Gannon’s Antiques and Art Center appraises jewelry. Each guest can have three items appraised with a donation of $20 per item to the EHS. Members save $5. 9285 Corkscrew Palms Blvd., Estero. Online registration is required for appraisals at https:// esterohistoricalsociety.com.
Kayaks and Birds – Sunset Birding Kayak Tour takes place from 4:15-6:15 p.m. today, Sunday, Monday and Wednesday, at Rookery Bay. Maybe the best way to see birds. $75 single; $140 or $150 tandem. Reservations required. 300 Tower Road, Naples. www.RookeryBay.org.
Lavell Crawford – Comedian and actor Lavell Crawford performs at 6:30 and 8:30 p.m. today, 6 and 8 p.m. Saturday and 6:30 p.m. Sunday at Off the Hook Comedy Club. He’s a man who needs no introduction. $30; $40 VIP. 2500 Vanderbilt Beach Road. 239-389-6901 or www.offthehookcomedy.com.

SATURDAY1.27
Bargains Here – The Naples Women’s Club’s annual Flea Market takes place from 9 a.m.-2 p.m. at the Naples Woman’s Clubhouse. The sale features countless items including clothing, housewares, electronics and toys. 570 Park St., Naples. 631-997-3632 or napleswomansclub.org.
Garden Painters – The Plein Air Fest takes place from 9 a.m.-5 p.m. at Naples Botanical Garden. Dozens of artists work in the garden painting en plein air. Take part in art-themed activities and tours. $25 adults, $10 age 4-17, free for members and younger than 4. 4820 Bayshore Dr., Naples. www.naplesgarden.org or 239-643-7275.
Doll Show – The Naples Doll Club hosts its annual Doll Show & Sale from 9 a.m.- 3 p.m. at Moorings Presbyterian Church. Find dolls from vintage and antique to modern, plus teddy bears, miniatures and doll clothes. A silent auction and raffle are also planned, and the Doll Doctor sees dolls needing repairs. 791 Harbour Dr., Naples. Free parking. $6 adults; free for younger than 10. 239-571-5082.
Vets Group – Gulf Coast Veterans & Friends meets for coffee, doughnuts, fellowship and stories at 10 a.m. on Saturdays at the Fleischmann Park Community Center. Veterans from World War II, Korea and Vietnam are welcomed. 1600 Fleischmann Blvd., Naples. 239-289-6952 or info@gulfcoastvf.org.
Car Show – West Coast Muscle Car Club’s 20th annual Car and Truck Show takes place at the North Collier Regional Park. See over 300 new and vintage cars and trucks on display, plus vendors, music and food trucks. Free parking and shuttle services. $15; free for age 12 and younger. Proceeds benefit local charities including the Avow Kids program, which supports children ages 5-17 who are experiencing grief or loss www.avowcares.org/wcmccshow or www.westcoastmusclecarclub.com.
Crafts and Cook-off – The Sunshine State Steak Cook-Off with Arts & Crafts Festival takes place from 10 a.m.-4 p.m. at Ave Maria Catholic Parish Church. The Sunshine State Steak Cook-Off, which claims to be the largest steak competition east of the Mississippi, runs from 2-6:30 p.m. Live music, a bounce house for kids. Proceeds from the Steak Cook-Off benefit local charities supported by the Knights of Columbus. 5088 Annunciation Cir., Ave Maria. avemariakofc.org/2024-sunshine state-steak-cook-off-tickets.
Arty Affair – The Mercato Art Celebration 2024 takes place from 10 a.m.-6 p.m. today and 9 a.m.-3 p.m. Sunday at Mercato. This two-day celebration of art on Strada hosted by Naples Picasso Events brings out the crowds to see artists, enjoy restaurant specials or grab a cocktail. Free. 9110 Strada Place, Naples. experiencemercato.com/events/mercato-art-celebration/.
Car Lovers – A weekly Car Cruise-In hosted by the Marco Island Corvette and Muscle Car Club takes place from 10 a.m.- 1 p.m. Saturdays in the Marco Island Lutheran Church parking lot. 525 N. Collier Blvd., Marco Island. www.marcoislandcorvettes.com.
Historic Event – The second annual Venezia Renaissance Faire returns for its final weekend from 10:30 a.m.-5 p.m. today and Sunday adjacent to the Bonita Springs Poker Room. Immerse yourself in the magic of the Renaissance era through entertainment like fire-eaters, acrobats and magicians, art and history. Tickets start at $20 online in advance; $23 at the gate. 28001 Old 41 Road, Bonita Springs. https:// events.veneziarenaissancefaire.com/.
Artisan Market – Mercato hosts a Hand & Harvest Artisan Market, holiday edition, from noon-4 p.m. in Ste. 3135, across from Z Gallerie & Tommy Bahama. Kids can take photos with Santa while parents shop 35+ local artisans selling a curated collection of handmade items from baked goods to fine art. Bubbles Bar offers mimosas benefiting Empty Bowls Naples. 9110 Strada Place, Naples. 239-254-1080 or experiencemercato.com.
Hey Kids – Live! Science Shows are hosted by the staff at Stemlab at 1:30 p.m. on Saturdays and Sundays at Miromar Outlets, Ste. 192, near WINK Playland. Get lessons on chemistry, aerodynamics and fire. 10801 Corkscrew Road, Estero. 239-948-3766 or www.miromaroutlets.com.
Live Music – Live at the Cove rocks the Cove Beer & Wine Bar at Paradise Coast Sports Complex from 5-8 p.m. with live music by the Geezers in Paradise and food and drink specials. 3940 City Gate Blvd. N., Naples. 239-252-4386 or playparadisecoast.com.
Dinner Dance – The Hungarian Club of Southwest Florida presents “Moonlight over Balaton,” a dinner and dancing event, at 6 p.m. at Forest Glen Country Club. The buffet menu includes chicken paprikash with spaetzle and chef-carved prime rib with dobos torte for dessert. There’s music by Talfi. 3855 Forest Glen Blvd., Naples. Reservations are required by Jan. 19 at 239-821-1814.

The Yoga and Yoga Nidra meditation uses gentle movements suitable for all levels welcome. BYO yoga mat, towel, water. A donation of $20 is requested in person or online at www.thepeacefulpresence.com. 27750 Old 41 Road, Bonita Springs. 847-776-8717, 239-949-0749 or www.ShangriLaSprings.com.

Garden Tour – Take an Organic Garden Tour from 10-11 a.m. Tuesdays at Shangri La Springs. Tours are led by Cecelia Morales, the organic garden manager, and include a sensory-based walking tour around the garden’s subtropical, tropical, annual and perennial crops and orchard. Register in advance. $15 per person. Closed-toe shoes, a hat, sunglasses and sunscreen, and a full water bottle are recommended. 27750 Old 41 Road, Bonita Springs. 239-949-0749 or www.ShangriLaSprings.com.
Trolley Tours – Free Trolley Tours with live music are offered from 11 a.m.-2 p.m. Tuesdays through April 23. One-hour narrated tours of Ave Maria, Collier County’s ‘Community of the Year,’ showcase the town and its history. After the tour, view 25+ model homes by premier builders. Free and it includes a trolley bag filled with swag. No reservations required. 239-352-3903 or visit AveMaria.com.

WEDNESDAY1.31
Guided Tours – The Naples Historical Society’s Official Walking Tours of the Naples Historic District have resumed and are offered on select Wednesdays at 9:30 a.m. The 90-minute docent-led tours take guests through the residential neighborhood of beautifully maintained private historic homes, all of which embody unique stories of Naples’ past. Tours begin and end at Historic Palm Cottage at 137 12th Ave. S., Naples. $16 members; $22 non-members. Reservations required. 888-472-1895 or napleshistoricalsociety.org.
Learn Bridge – Bridge declarer play lessons are offered from 9 a.m.-noon Wednesdays at Elks Lodge No. 2010. No partner needed. 11250 Tamiami Trail E., Naples. Register at 239-775-8460 with Marcia.
Chair Yoga – Chair Yoga classes are offered from 1-2 p.m. Wednesdays at the Fleischmann Community Center. A gentle practice of stretching and centering poses done on or next to a chair. 1600 Fleischmann Blvd., Naples. An online chair yoga class is offered from 11 a.m.-noon on Tuesdays. Led by Jean Erlbaum, certified master yoga teacher. 413-230-1518 or jean.erlbaum@verizon.net.

Tickets: $49. Reservations required. 10150 Bonita Beach Road, Bonita Springs. 239-495-8989 or www.artcenterbonita.org.

Heathwood Dr., Marco Island.239-389-6447 or www.themihs.org.

LOOKING AHEAD
Food and Beer – A Food Truck Rally & Pop-up Biergarten takes place from 3-9 p.m. Feb.1-2 and noon-9 p.m. Feb. 3 at Riverside Park. The event is hosted by the Bonita Springs Historical Society. 10451 Old 41 Road, Bonita Springs. $28 or $49 VIP at www.eventbrite.com.
The Ultimate Car Show – The Naples Automotive Experience kicks off with a Jetport Reception from 6-10 p.m. Feb. 1, followed by events at various locations Feb. 2-4. Shelby American reveals the new Shelby Series 2 car, plus exotic cars, jets, planes, helicopters and more are showcased. There’s also a cigar lounge, fine wine tasting, food and music. Reservations required. www.naplesautomotiveexperience.org.
Elvis in Town – World champion tribute artist Ted Torres Martin’s portrayal of The King of Rock N’ Roll is on stage at 6:30 p.m. Feb. 1 at the Rose History Auditorium. He’s called one of the world’s top tributes — a title he earned in Memphis from Elvis Presley Enterprises. Doors open at 6 p.m. $50. 180 S. Heathwood Dr., Marco Island. themihs.org or 239-389-6447.
Al Fresco Concert – Mercato Nights Music Series continues from 6:30-8:30 p.m. Feb. 1 with a performance by Cayman on the event lawn at Mercato. Food and drinks for purchase from the Zza Baby food truck and The Pubs outdoor bar. BYO lawn chairs and blankets. Leashed pets welcomed. 9110 Strada Place, Naples. 239-254-1080 or experiencemercato.com.
Classic Film Screening – Naples Cinematheque presents an outdoor showing of “Trainspotting” from 7-9 p.m. Feb. 1 at The Burrow. The new restoration allows viewers to see all the debauchery in crystal clear color. 1780 Commercial Dr., Naples. $12. www.naplescinematheque.com/events.
Bonita Concert – R Howard and The Incorrigibles present “Total Rock ‘N’ Roll Recall” at 7:30 p.m. Feb. 1 in the Moe Auditorium at Arts Bonita. The show features three well-respected local musicians: Darrell Nutt on drums, Susie Hulcher on bass and vocals, and Ricky Howard on guitar and vocals, joined by the special guest artist Matt Baxley on keyboards and vocals. $35 and $45. 10150 Bonita Beach Road, Bonita Springs. 239-495-8989 or www.artcenterbonita.org.
Seafood Fest – The 2024 Everglades Seafood Festival marks its 54th year Feb. 2-4 in Everglades City. It’s three days of live country music, carnival rides, arts, crafts and seafood. Headliner Lonestar performs at 8 p.m. Saturday. 102 Copeland Ave. N., Everglades City. evergladesseafoodfestival.org/.
Weekend Unwind – The Estero Historical Society hosts a “First Friday on the Deck” from 4-6 p.m. Feb. 2 at its headquarters. This flavored Vodka Tasting Fundraiser features four flavored vodkas paired with appetizers in a natural environment. $25 members; $30 non-members. 9285 Corkscrew Palms Blvd., Estero. RSVP required at EsteroHistoricalSociety.com or 239-272-1911.
Opera Event – “A Toast To Opera: Madama Butterfly” takes place at 4 p.m. Feb. 2 at the Naples Botanical Garden. This is a special opportunity to learn about the opera before it’s performed by the Naples Opera in March. Dr. Tom Cimarusti, Florida Gulf Coast University Professor of Musicology, speaks and answers questions. Wine and light bites follow. $38. Student tickets with ID are available through the box office only. 239-963-9050 or https:// operanaples.org.
Evening in the Garden – The Naples Garden’s Friday After 5 from 5-7 p.m. Feb. 2 features the Naples Opera resident artists performing select arias from “Madama Butterfly” and other well-known works. The Naples Philharmonic Youth Jazz Orchestra also performs, and the Fogg Café stays open with a full menu and bar. 4820 Bayshore Dr., Naples. www.naplesgarden.org or 239-643-7275.

FRIDAY1.26
Love Wine? – The Naples Winter Wine Festival takes place today-Sunday at The Ritz-Carlton Golf Resort. This high-end wine event features live and virtual auctions, taskings, dinners, luncheons and a celebration brunch. Tickets are sold for the entire Festival only. Proceeds from the Festival benefit the Naples Children & Education Foundation. 2600 Tiburon Blvd., Naples. 239-514-2239 or email Lisa Juliano at lisa@napleswinefestival.com.
Shelling Time – Life’s a Beach Barrier Island Shelling is offered from 9 a.m.-noon Friday-Tuesday and 1 p.m. Wednesday at Rookery Bay. Join this shell-search adventure. $99. Reservations required. 300 Tower Road, Naples. www.RookeryBay.org.
Collier County Chat – Garden Side Chickee Chat, the first of three, takes place from 11 a.m.-noon at the Historic Palm Cottage. Crystal Kinzel, Clerk of the Circuit Court and Comptroller for Collier County, speaks about the future of Collier County and answers questions. $8, member discount. Also meets Feb. 23 and March 29. at 137 12th Ave. S., Naples. www.NaplesHistoricalSociety.org or 239-261-8164.
Don’t Miss – A Pre-owned Jewelry Sale takes place from noon-6:30 p.m. today and 8:30 a.m.-3 p.m. Saturday at the Estero Historical Society. From 4-6:30 p.m. today and 8:30 a.m.-noon Saturday, Rick Gannon of Gannon’s Antiques and Art Center appraises jewelry. Each guest can have three items appraised with a donation of $20 per item to the EHS. Members save $5. 9285 Corkscrew Palms Blvd., Estero. Online registration is required for appraisals at https:// esterohistoricalsociety.com.
Kayaks and Birds – Sunset Birding Kayak Tour takes place from 4:15-6:15 p.m. today, Sunday, Monday and Wednesday, at Rookery Bay. Maybe the best way to see birds. $75 single; $140 or $150 tandem. Reservations required. 300 Tower Road, Naples. www.RookeryBay.org.
Lavell Crawford – Comedian and actor Lavell Crawford performs at 6:30 and 8:30 p.m. today, 6 and 8 p.m. Saturday and 6:30 p.m. Sunday at Off the Hook Comedy Club. He’s a man who needs no introduction. $30; $40 VIP. 2500 Vanderbilt Beach Road. 239-389-6901 or www.offthehookcomedy.com.
Live Show – The Friday Night Concert Series features live music by The Freecoasters from 6-8 p.m. in the Restaurant Piazza at Miromar Outlets. BYO chair. 10801 Corkscrew Road, Estero. miromaroutlets.com/event-directory.
Live Music – Johnny Caribe & The Hurricanes perform from 7-10 p.m. at The Center Bar at the Promenade at Bonita Bay. 26811 S. Bay Dr., Bonita Springs. Free. www.thecenterbar.com.
At The Stage – The Stage presents an eclectic matchup of great tribute artists at 7:30 p.m. See The Rolling Stones, Creedence Clearwater Revival and the Doobie Brothers. Doors open at 5 p.m. Dinner is served until 8:30 p.m. Reservations. 9144 Bonita Beach Road, Bonita Springs. 239-405-8566 or www.stagebonita.com.
Live Music – Johnny Orr performs from 8-11 p.m. at Z’s Music Kitchen. 12655 Tamiami Trail E., Naples. 239-304-9552 or www.zsmusickitchen.com/.
The Zig Zag – The Electric Xperience performs from 8 p.m.-midnight tonight and Saturday at the Zig Zag Lounge at Seminole Casino Hotel Immokalee. 506 S. First St., Immokalee. 800-218-0007, moreinparadise.com or facebook.com/SeminoleCasinoHotel/.

SATURDAY1.27
Bargains Here – The Naples Women’s Club’s annual Flea Market takes place from 9 a.m.-2 p.m. at the Naples Woman’s Clubhouse. The sale features countless items including clothing, housewares, electronics and toys. 570 Park St., Naples. 631-997-3632 or napleswomansclub.org.
Garden Painters – The Plein Air Fest takes place from 9 a.m.-5 p.m. at Naples Botanical Garden. Dozens of artists work in the garden painting en plein air. Take part in art-themed activities and tours. $25 adults, $10 age 4-17, free for members and younger than 4. 4820 Bayshore Dr., Naples. www.naplesgarden.org or 239-643-7275.
Doll Show – The Naples Doll Club hosts its annual Doll Show & Sale from 9 a.m.- 3 p.m. at Moorings Presbyterian Church. Find dolls from vintage and antique to modern, plus teddy bears, miniatures and doll clothes. A silent auction and raffle are also planned, and the Doll Doctor sees dolls needing repairs. 791 Harbour Dr., Naples. Free parking. $6 adults; free for younger than 10. 239-571-5082.
Vets Group – Gulf Coast Veterans & Friends meets for coffee, doughnuts, fellowship and stories at 10 a.m. on Saturdays at the Fleischmann Park Community Center. Veterans from World War II, Korea and Vietnam are welcomed. 1600 Fleischmann Blvd., Naples. 239-289-6952 or info@gulfcoastvf.org.
Car Show – West Coast Muscle Car Club’s 20th annual Car and Truck Show takes place at the North Collier Regional Park. See over 300 new and vintage cars and trucks on display, plus vendors, music and food trucks. Free parking and shuttle services. $15; free for age 12 and younger. Proceeds benefit local charities including the Avow Kids program, which supports children ages 5-17 who are experiencing grief or loss www.avowcares.org/wcmccshow or www.westcoastmusclecarclub.com.
Crafts and Cook-off – The Sunshine State Steak Cook-Off with Arts & Crafts Festival takes place from 10 a.m.-4 p.m. at Ave Maria Catholic Parish Church. The Sunshine State Steak Cook-Off, which claims to be the largest steak competition east of the Mississippi, runs from 2-6:30 p.m. Live music, a bounce house for kids. Proceeds from the Steak Cook-Off benefit local charities supported by the Knights of Columbus. 5088 Annunciation Cir., Ave Maria. avemariakofc.org/2024-sunshine state-steak-cook-off-tickets.
Arty Affair – The Mercato Art Celebration 2024 takes place from 10 a.m.-6 p.m. today and 9 a.m.-3 p.m. Sunday at Mercato. This two-day celebration of art on Strada hosted by Naples Picasso Events brings out the crowds to see artists, enjoy restaurant specials or grab a cocktail. Free. 9110 Strada Place, Naples. experiencemercato.com/events/mercato-art-celebration/.
Car Lovers – A weekly Car Cruise-In hosted by the Marco Island Corvette and Muscle Car Club takes place from 10 a.m.- 1 p.m. Saturdays in the Marco Island Lutheran Church parking lot. 525 N. Collier Blvd., Marco Island. www.marcoislandcorvettes.com.
Historic Event – The second annual Venezia Renaissance Faire returns for its final weekend from 10:30 a.m.-5 p.m. today and Sunday adjacent to the Bonita Springs Poker Room. Immerse yourself in the magic of the Renaissance era through entertainment like fire-eaters, acrobats and magicians, art and history. Tickets start at $20 online in advance; $23 at the gate. 28001 Old 41 Road, Bonita Springs. https:// events.veneziarenaissancefaire.com/.
Artisan Market – Mercato hosts a Hand & Harvest Artisan Market, holiday edition, from noon-4 p.m. in Ste. 3135, across from Z Gallerie & Tommy Bahama. Kids can take photos with Santa while parents shop 35+ local artisans selling a curated collection of handmade items from baked goods to fine art. Bubbles Bar offers mimosas benefiting Empty Bowls Naples. 9110 Strada Place, Naples. 239-254-1080 or experiencemercato.com.
Hey Kids – Live! Science Shows are hosted by the staff at Stemlab at 1:30 p.m. on Saturdays and Sundays at Miromar Outlets, Ste. 192, near WINK Playland. Get lessons on chemistry, aerodynamics and fire. 10801 Corkscrew Road, Estero. 239-948-3766 or www.miromaroutlets.com.
Live Music – Live at the Cove rocks the Cove Beer & Wine Bar at Paradise Coast Sports Complex from 5-8 p.m. with live music by the Geezers in Paradise and food and drink specials. 3940 City Gate Blvd. N., Naples. 239-252-4386 or playparadisecoast.com.
Dinner Dance – The Hungarian Club of Southwest Florida presents “Moonlight over Balaton,” a dinner and dancing event, at 6 p.m. at Forest Glen Country Club. The buffet menu includes chicken paprikash with spaetzle and chef-carved prime rib with dobos torte for dessert. There’s music by Talfi. 3855 Forest Glen Blvd., Naples. Reservations are required by Jan. 19 at 239-821-1814.
Weekly Concert – Live Music Under the Banyan Tree is offered from 6-8 p.m. Saturdays at Mercato. Wendell Ray performs. 9110 Strada Place, Naples. 239-254-1080 or experiencemercato.com.
Live Music – Simply Fi performs from 7-10 p.m. at The Center Bar at the Promenade at Bonita Bay. 26811 S. Bay Dr., Bonita Springs. Free. www.thecenterbar.com.
At The Stage – The Stage presents a Fleetwood Mac & the Stevie Nicks Tribute Show at 7:30 p.m. Doors open at 5 p.m. Dinner is served until 8:30 p.m. Reservations. 9144 Bonita Beach Road, Bonita Springs. 239-405-8566 or www.stagebonita.com.
Live Music – The Coral Stone Band performs from 8-11 p.m. at Z’s Music Kitchen. 12655 Tamiami Trail E., Naples. 239-304-9552 or www.zsmusickitchen.com/.
SUNDAY1.28
Yoga Challenge – Get up early for Sunrise Yoga from 7-8 a.m. Sundays through Feb. 4 at The Factory at Paradise Coast Sports Complex. The instructor is Patty Kulak. Free. 3940 City Gate Blvd. N., Naples. 239-252-4386 or playparadisecoast.com.
Say “Woof” – Visit Naples Botanical Garden with your four-legged friend during Dogs in the Garden from 9-11 a.m. on Sundays and Tuesdays. Take a dog hike through the lush, fragrant foliage. One dog per person. No retractable leashes. Register at the front desk on your first visit. BYO water bowl. 4820 Bayshore Dr., Naples. 239-643-7275.
Church in the Park – Celebration Church meets at 9:30 a.m. Sundays in the Cambier Park Bandshell. 755 8th Ave S., Naples. 239-207-1704.
Big Band – The Naples Big Band performs at 2 p.m. in Cambier Park. The 17-piece jazz ensemble performs. BYO chairs or blankets. Free. 755 8th Ave. S., Naples. www.naplesbigband.com.
Live Music – Laurie & Rusty Wright perform from 5-9 p.m. at The Center Bar at the Promenade at Bonita Bay. 26811 S. Bay Dr., Bonita Springs. Free. www.thecenterbar.com.
Classic Film Screening – Naples Cinematheque presents an outdoor showing of 1979’s “Romy & Michele’s High School Reunion” from 7-9 p.m. at The Burrow. Party girls return to high school. 1780 Commercial Dr., Naples. $12. www.naplescinematheque.com/events.
At The Stage – The Stage presents a fan favorite, the Neil Diamond Tribute Show beginning at 7 p.m. There’s also a special tribute to Barbra Streisand. Doors open at 5 p.m. Dinner is served until 8:30 p.m. Reservations. 9144 Bonita Beach Road, Bonita Springs. 239-405-8566 or www.stagebonita.com.
Croce Plays Croce – A.J. Croce performs the songs of his father in the “Croce Plays Croce 50th Anniversary” show at 8 p.m. in Seminole Center at the Seminole Casino Hotel Immokalee. A.J. Croce celebrates two of his father Jim’s legendary albums: ‘73’s “Life and Times” and “I Got A Name,” his final release. Tickets start at $79. 506 S. First St., Immokalee. www.Ticketmaster.com or at www.moreinparadise.com.
MONDAY1.29
In Concert – Join Paul Todd with special guests in a musical performance of “The Best Songs and Singers of the 70’s & 80’s” at 7 p.m. tonight and Tuesday in St. Agnes Parish Hall. Todd accompanies his smooth vocals and guest performers by simultaneously playing six keyboards and on piano. $30. 7775 Vanderbilt Beach Road, Naples. 239-272-0297 or toni@tonitrombley.com.
Monday Yoga Class – Shangri-La Springs offers a scenic outdoor Meditation in Motion class from 9:30-10:30 a.m. Mondays. The Yoga and Yoga Nidra meditation uses gentle movements suitable for all levels welcome. BYO yoga mat, towel, water. A donation of $20 is requested in person or online at www.thepeacefulpresence.com. 27750 Old 41 Road, Bonita Springs. 847-776-8717, 239-949-0749 or www.ShangriLaSprings.com.
Swap Tales – VFW Post 7721 hosts Operation Chewing the Fat from 10 a.m.- noon every Monday through Friday at the Post. Share “war stories and a bunch of lies” over coffee and sweets. 1313 Collier Blvd., Naples. 239-455-7721 or post7721@VFWFL. org.
Dinner & A Movie – The Naples Italian American Foundation’s Pasta Dinner and An Italian Movie is offered. Doors open at 5 p.m. Dinner is at 5:30 p.m. and the movie begins at 6:30 p.m. Held every other Monday through March. $20 members; $25 non-members. Film: “La Giusta Distanza” (in Italian with English subtitles). 7035 Airport Pulling Road, Naples. 239-597-5210 or www.niafoundation.org.
Live Music – Ed Ziehm performs from 6-9 p.m. at The Center Bar at the Promenade at Bonita Bay. 26811 S. Bay Dr., Bonita Springs. Free. www.thecenterbar.com.
At The Zig Zag – Sideshow Bob performs from 6-10 p.m. at the Zig Zag Lounge at Seminole Casino Hotel Immokalee. 506 S. First St., Immokalee. 800-218-0007 or moreinparadise.com or facebook.com/ SeminoleCasinoHotel/.
Be Happy in the New Year – A course in “Meditation and Essential Advice” is offered from 7-8 p.m. at Unity of Bonita Springs Church. This recipe for a happy life given the state of the modern world is offered by Gen Namdrol, resident teacher of Samudrabadra Kadampa Buddhist Center in Fort Myers. No experience is needed. $12 at the door. 28285 Imperial Pkwy., Bonita Springs. www.meditationinfortmyers.org.
Funny Guy – Comedian Bob Marley performs at 7:30 p.m. today and Tuesday and 5:30 and 7:30 p.m. Wednesday at Off the Hook Comedy Club. He’s a regular on radio in his home state of Maine, which is also the primary source of his storytelling. $35; $45 VIP. 2500 Vanderbilt Beach Road. 239-389-6901 or www.offthehookcomedy.com.
At The Stage – The Stage presents an eclectic matchup of great tribute artists at 7:30 p.m. See Bob Seger, Billy Joel, Lady Gaga and Cher. Doors open at 5 p.m. Dinner is served until 8:30 p.m. Reservations. 9144 Bonita Beach Road, Bonita Springs. 239-405-8566 or www.stagebonita.com.
TUESDAY1.30
Garden Tour – Take an Organic Garden Tour from 10-11 a.m. Tuesdays at Shangri La Springs. Tours are led by Cecelia Morales, the organic garden manager, and include a sensory-based walking tour around the garden’s subtropical, tropical, annual and perennial crops and orchard. Register in advance. $15 per person. Closed-toe shoes, a hat, sunglasses and sunscreen, and a full water bottle are recommended. 27750 Old 41 Road, Bonita Springs. 239-949-0749 or www.ShangriLaSprings.com.
Trolley Tours – Free Trolley Tours with live music are offered from 11 a.m.-2 p.m. Tuesdays through April 23. One-hour narrated tours of Ave Maria, Collier County’s ‘Community of the Year,’ showcase the town and its history. After the tour, view 25+ model homes by premier builders. Free and it includes a trolley bag filled with swag. No reservations required. 239-352-3903 or visit AveMaria.com.
Live Music – Bill Beck performs from 6-9 p.m. at The Center Bar at the Promenade at Bonita Bay. 26811 S. Bay Dr., Bonita Springs. Free. www.thecenterbar.com.
At The Zig Zag – Cayman performs from 6-10 p.m. at the Zig Zag Lounge at Seminole Casino Hotel Immokalee. 506 S. First St., Immokalee. 800-218-0007 or moreinparadise.com or facebook.com/ SeminoleCasinoHotel/.
Poker Night – Poker Night at The Cove Beer & Wine Bar in Paradise Coast Sports Complex is held from 6:30-10 p.m. Tuesdays. Win a $25 gift card. $10 donation. Food trucks on-site. 3940 City Gate Blvd. N., Naples. 239-252-4386 or playparadisecoast.com.
The Moment – Gulfshore Opera presents “Love’s First Blush” at 7 p.m. in Daniels Pavilion at Artis—Naples. It’s a recital program featuring music that captures the first moment you know you’re in love, from soaring melodies to haunting arias and impassioned duets. Tickets: $59. 5833 Pelican Bay Blvd., Naples. 239-529-3925 or gulfshoreopera.org or artisnaples.org/.
At The Stage – The Stage presents the Johnny Rogers Band playing tribute to an eclectic matchup of tributes to artists who got their start in the ’50s — Elvis, Roy Orbison, Buddy Holly and Jerry Lee Lewis — at 7:30 p.m. Doors open at 5 p.m. Dinner is served until 8:30 p.m. Reservations. 9144 Bonita Beach Road, Bonita Springs. 239-405-8566 or www.stagebonita.com.
Lively Jam – An Open Jam hosted by Greg Stone takes place from 8-11 p.m. at Z’s Music Kitchen. 12655 Tamiami Trail E., Naples. 239-304-9552 or www.zsmusickitchen.com/.
WEDNESDAY1.31
Guided Tours – The Naples Historical Society’s Official Walking Tours of the Naples Historic District have resumed and are offered on select Wednesdays at 9:30 a.m. The 90-minute docent-led tours take guests through the residential neighborhood of beautifully maintained private historic homes, all of which embody unique stories of Naples’ past. Tours begin and end at Historic Palm Cottage at 137 12th Ave. S., Naples. $16 members; $22 non-members. Reservations required. 888-472-1895 or napleshistoricalsociety.org.
Learn Bridge – Bridge declarer play lessons are offered from 9 a.m.-noon Wednesdays at Elks Lodge No. 2010. No partner needed. 11250 Tamiami Trail E., Naples. Register at 239-775-8460 with Marcia.
Chair Yoga – Chair Yoga classes are offered from 1-2 p.m. Wednesdays at the Fleischmann Community Center. A gentle practice of stretching and centering poses done on or next to a chair. 1600 Fleischmann Blvd., Naples. An online chair yoga class is offered from 11 a.m.-noon on Tuesdays. Led by Jean Erlbaum, certified master yoga teacher. 413-230-1518 or jean.erlbaum@verizon.net.
Music Lecture – The History of Ragtime Music, a lecture and presentation, is offered from noon-1:30 p.m. in the Moe Auditorium at Arts Bonita. Peter Bergin speaks. A catered lunch is included. Tickets: $49. Reservations required. 10150 Bonita Beach Road, Bonita Springs. 239-495-8989 or www.artcenterbonita.org.
Lecture – Marco Island’s Water Quality & Environmental Advocacy takes place at 2 p.m. at the Marco Island Historical Society. Nanette Rivera from the Conservancy of Southwest Florida presents this lecture about how the public can advocate for its protection. $10 at the door, free for members. Reservations. 180 S. Heathwood Dr., Marco Island.239-389-6447 or www.themihs.org.
At the Zig Zag – The Steven Amato Band performs from 6-10 p.m. at the Zig Zag Lounge at Seminole Casino Hotel Immokalee. 506 S. First St., Immokalee. 800-218-0007, moreinparadise.com or facebook.com/SeminoleCasinoHotel/.
Live Music – Josh Rowand performs from 6-9 p.m. at The Center Bar at the Promenade at Bonita Bay. 26811 S. Bay Dr., Bonita Springs. Free. www.thecenterbar.com.
At The Stage – The Stage presents an eclectic matchup of great artists at 7:30 p.m. Rod Stewart, Tom Jones and Meatloaf backed their show band, plus special guest tribute artist Linda Ronstadt, Patsy Cline and Celine Dion. Doors open at 5 p.m. Dinner is served until 8:30 p.m. Reservations. 9144 Bonita Beach Road, Bonita Springs. 239-405-8566 or www.stagebonita.com.
LOOKING AHEAD
Food and Beer – A Food Truck Rally & Pop-up Biergarten takes place from 3-9 p.m. Feb.1-2 and noon-9 p.m. Feb. 3 at Riverside Park. The event is hosted by the Bonita Springs Historical Society. 10451 Old 41 Road, Bonita Springs. $28 or $49 VIP at www.eventbrite.com.
The Ultimate Car Show – The Naples Automotive Experience kicks off with a Jetport Reception from 6-10 p.m. Feb. 1, followed by events at various locations Feb. 2-4. Shelby American reveals the new Shelby Series 2 car, plus exotic cars, jets, planes, helicopters and more are showcased. There’s also a cigar lounge, fine wine tasting, food and music. Reservations required. www.naplesautomotiveexperience.org.
Elvis in Town – World champion tribute artist Ted Torres Martin’s portrayal of The King of Rock N’ Roll is on stage at 6:30 p.m. Feb. 1 at the Rose History Auditorium. He’s called one of the world’s top tributes — a title he earned in Memphis from Elvis Presley Enterprises. Doors open at 6 p.m. $50. 180 S. Heathwood Dr., Marco Island. themihs.org or 239-389-6447.
Al Fresco Concert – Mercato Nights Music Series continues from 6:30-8:30 p.m. Feb. 1 with a performance by Cayman on the event lawn at Mercato. Food and drinks for purchase from the Zza Baby food truck and The Pubs outdoor bar. BYO lawn chairs and blankets. Leashed pets welcomed. 9110 Strada Place, Naples. 239-254-1080 or experiencemercato.com.
Classic Film Screening – Naples Cinematheque presents an outdoor showing of “Trainspotting” from 7-9 p.m. Feb. 1 at The Burrow. The new restoration allows viewers to see all the debauchery in crystal clear color. 1780 Commercial Dr., Naples. $12. www.naplescinematheque.com/events.
Bonita Concert – R Howard and The Incorrigibles present “Total Rock ‘N’ Roll Recall” at 7:30 p.m. Feb. 1 in the Moe Auditorium at Arts Bonita. The show features three well-respected local musicians: Darrell Nutt on drums, Susie Hulcher on bass and vocals, and Ricky Howard on guitar and vocals, joined by the special guest artist Matt Baxley on keyboards and vocals. $35 and $45. 10150 Bonita Beach Road, Bonita Springs. 239-495-8989 or www.artcenterbonita.org.
Seafood Fest – The 2024 Everglades Seafood Festival marks its 54th year Feb. 2-4 in Everglades City. It’s three days of live country music, carnival rides, arts, crafts and seafood. Headliner Lonestar performs at 8 p.m. Saturday. 102 Copeland Ave. N., Everglades City. evergladesseafoodfestival.org/.
Weekend Unwind – The Estero Historical Society hosts a “First Friday on the Deck” from 4-6 p.m. Feb. 2 at its headquarters. This flavored Vodka Tasting Fundraiser features four flavored vodkas paired with appetizers in a natural environment. $25 members; $30 non-members. 9285 Corkscrew Palms Blvd., Estero. RSVP required at EsteroHistoricalSociety.com or 239-272-1911.
Opera Event – “A Toast To Opera: Madama Butterfly” takes place at 4 p.m. Feb. 2 at the Naples Botanical Garden. This is a special opportunity to learn about the opera before it’s performed by the Naples Opera in March. Dr. Tom Cimarusti, Florida Gulf Coast University Professor of Musicology, speaks and answers questions. Wine and light bites follow. $38. Student tickets with ID are available through the box office only. 239-963-9050 or https:// operanaples.org.
Evening in the Garden – The Naples Garden’s Friday After 5 from 5-7 p.m. Feb. 2 features the Naples Opera resident artists performing select arias from “Madama Butterfly” and other well-known works. The Naples Philharmonic Youth Jazz Orchestra also performs, and the Fogg Café stays open with a full menu and bar. 4820 Bayshore Dr., Naples. www.naplesgarden.org or 239-643-7275.
Tribute Show – The Legends Concert Series continues from 6-10 p.m. Feb. 2 with a tribute concert performance of The Cars and Journey on the East Lawn at Paradise Coast Sports Complex. Tickets: $40; $75 platinum and $125 VIP includes two drink tickets and one food ticket. Food and drink for purchase. 3940 City Gate Blvd. N., Naples. 239-252-4386 or https:// playparadisecoast.com. ¦
 

Special event – The 20th anniversary celebration and fundraiser “Off The Walls!” take place from 6-9 p.m. at the Performing Art Center. Arts Bonita’s signature fundraising event supports scholarships and youth programs. This showcase of art and collectibles features random drawings for artworks, cuisine adventures, décor and luxury items. A catered hors d’oeuvres buffet, wine and beer, and a decadent dessert bar. Live entertainment. $200 single tickets; $325 couples. 10150 Bonita Beach Road, Bonita Springs. artcenterbonita.org or 239-495-8989.
Songbook Concert – The Broadway Hollywood Songbook is on the program at 6 and 8:30 p.m. at Daniels Pavilion at Artis—Naples. The concert features Scott Coulter, vocalist, Jessica Hendy, vocalist, John Boswell, piano and vocalist and Paul Shewchuk, bass. Hear the biggest songs from the biggest musicals from stage and screen. 5833 Pelican Bay Blvd., Naples. artisnaples.org.
The Zig Zag – Simply Fi performs from 6-10 p.m. at the Zig Zag Lounge at Seminole Casino Hotel Immokalee. 506 S. First St., Immokalee. 800-218-0007, moreinparadise.com or facebook.com/SeminoleCasinoHotel/.
Singers Sought – Join the Paradise Coastmen Barbershop Chorus at rehearsal at 6:30 p.m. Thursdays at Our Savior Lutheran Church. Singers are wanted or just come to listen. 1955 Curling Ave., Naples. 239-362-6366 or www.ParadiseCoastmen.org.
Rubino & Rimi – It’s an Italian & Stallion Comedy Special with Fred Rubino & Carl Rimi at 7 p.m. at Off the Hook Comedy Club. Fred Rubino is a standup comic from Brooklyn who performs all over the East Coast and Carl Rimi is a seasoned stand-up comedian with a remarkable 28-year career. This is a two-fer of Italian comedians. $24; $35 VIP; or get a VIP suite for 5 people for $250. 2500 Vanderbilt Beach Road. 239- 389-6901 or www.offthehookcomedy.com.
Italian Opera – The Gulfshore Opera presents “A Night In Italy” at 7 p.m. at the St. Leo’s Parish Life Center. Experience an all-Italian evening of opera with arias, ensembles, Canzone Napoletana, and popular songs performed by Gulfshore Opera’s professional artists-in-residence. $40 or $55 for premium tickets, which include front center seating and a meet-the-artists reception following the concert. 28290 Beaumont Road, Bonita Springs. 239-529-3925 or https:// gulfshoreopera.org/.
At The Stage – The Stage presents the Alter Eagles tribute band at 7:30 p.m. One of the most requested acts, this show is likely to sell out. Dinner seating from 5:30-7 p.m. Reservations. 9144 Bonita Beach Road, Bonita Springs. 239-405-8566 or www.stagebonita.com.
FRIDAY1.26
Love Wine? – The Naples Winter Wine Festival takes place today-Sunday at The Ritz-Carlton Golf Resort. This high-end wine event features live and virtual auctions, taskings, dinners, luncheons and a celebration brunch. Tickets are sold for the entire Festival only. Proceeds from the Festival benefit the Naples Children & Education Foundation. 2600 Tiburon Blvd., Naples. 239-514-2239 or email Lisa Juliano at lisa@napleswinefestival.com.
Shelling Time – Life’s a Beach Barrier Island Shelling is offered from 9 a.m.-noon Friday-Tuesday and 1 p.m. Wednesday at Rookery Bay. Join this shell-search adventure. $99. Reservations required. 300 Tower Road, Naples. www.RookeryBay.org.
Collier County Chat – Garden Side Chickee Chat, the first of three, takes place from 11 a.m.-noon at the Historic Palm Cottage. Crystal Kinzel, Clerk of the Circuit Court and Comptroller for Collier County, speaks about the future of Collier County and answers questions. $8, member discount. Also meets Feb. 23 and March 29. at 137 12th Ave. S., Naples. www.NaplesHistoricalSociety.org or 239-261-8164.
Don’t Miss – A Pre-owned Jewelry Sale takes place from noon-6:30 p.m. today and 8:30 a.m.-3 p.m. Saturday at the Estero Historical Society. From 4-6:30 p.m. today and 8:30 a.m.-noon Saturday, Rick Gannon of Gannon’s Antiques and Art Center appraises jewelry. Each guest can have three items appraised with a donation of $20 per item to the EHS. Members save $5. 9285 Corkscrew Palms Blvd., Estero. Online registration is required for appraisals at https:// esterohistoricalsociety.com.
Kayaks and Birds – Sunset Birding Kayak Tour takes place from 4:15-6:15 p.m. today, Sunday, Monday and Wednesday, at Rookery Bay. Maybe the best way to see birds. $75 single; $140 or $150 tandem. Reservations required. 300 Tower Road, Naples. www.RookeryBay.org.
Lavell Crawford – Comedian and actor Lavell Crawford performs at 6:30 and 8:30 p.m. today, 6 and 8 p.m. Saturday and 6:30 p.m. Sunday at Off the Hook Comedy Club. He’s a man who needs no introduction. $30; $40 VIP. 2500 Vanderbilt Beach Road. 239-389-6901 or www.offthehookcomedy.com.

SATURDAY1.27
Bargains Here – The Naples Women’s Club’s annual Flea Market takes place from 9 a.m.-2 p.m. at the Naples Woman’s Clubhouse. The sale features countless items including clothing, housewares, electronics and toys. 570 Park St., Naples. 631-997-3632 or napleswomansclub.org.
Garden Painters – The Plein Air Fest takes place from 9 a.m.-5 p.m. at Naples Botanical Garden. Dozens of artists work in the garden painting en plein air. Take part in art-themed activities and tours. $25 adults, $10 age 4-17, free for members and younger than 4. 4820 Bayshore Dr., Naples. www.naplesgarden.org or 239-643-7275.
Doll Show – The Naples Doll Club hosts its annual Doll Show & Sale from 9 a.m.- 3 p.m. at Moorings Presbyterian Church. Find dolls from vintage and antique to modern, plus teddy bears, miniatures and doll clothes. A silent auction and raffle are also planned, and the Doll Doctor sees dolls needing repairs. 791 Harbour Dr., Naples. Free parking. $6 adults; free for younger than 10. 239-571-5082.
Vets Group – Gulf Coast Veterans & Friends meets for coffee, doughnuts, fellowship and stories at 10 a.m. on Saturdays at the Fleischmann Park Community Center. Veterans from World War II, Korea and Vietnam are welcomed. 1600 Fleischmann Blvd., Naples. 239-289-6952 or info@gulfcoastvf.org.
Car Show – West Coast Muscle Car Club’s 20th annual Car and Truck Show takes place at the North Collier Regional Park. See over 300 new and vintage cars and trucks on display, plus vendors, music and food trucks. Free parking and shuttle services. $15; free for age 12 and younger. Proceeds benefit local charities including the Avow Kids program, which supports children ages 5-17 who are experiencing grief or loss www.avowcares.org/wcmccshow or www.westcoastmusclecarclub.com.
Crafts and Cook-off – The Sunshine State Steak Cook-Off with Arts & Crafts Festival takes place from 10 a.m.-4 p.m. at Ave Maria Catholic Parish Church. The Sunshine State Steak Cook-Off, which claims to be the largest steak competition east of the Mississippi, runs from 2-6:30 p.m. Live music, a bounce house for kids. Proceeds from the Steak Cook-Off benefit local charities supported by the Knights of Columbus. 5088 Annunciation Cir., Ave Maria. avemariakofc.org/2024-sunshine state-steak-cook-off-tickets.
Arty Affair – The Mercato Art Celebration 2024 takes place from 10 a.m.-6 p.m. today and 9 a.m.-3 p.m. Sunday at Mercato. This two-day celebration of art on Strada hosted by Naples Picasso Events brings out the crowds to see artists, enjoy restaurant specials or grab a cocktail. Free. 9110 Strada Place, Naples. experiencemercato.com/events/mercato-art-celebration/.
Car Lovers – A weekly Car Cruise-In hosted by the Marco Island Corvette and Muscle Car Club takes place from 10 a.m.- 1 p.m. Saturdays in the Marco Island Lutheran Church parking lot. 525 N. Collier Blvd., Marco Island. www.marcoislandcorvettes.com.
Historic Event – The second annual Venezia Renaissance Faire returns for its final weekend from 10:30 a.m.-5 p.m. today and Sunday adjacent to the Bonita Springs Poker Room. Immerse yourself in the magic of the Renaissance era through entertainment like fire-eaters, acrobats and magicians, art and history. Tickets start at $20 online in advance; $23 at the gate. 28001 Old 41 Road, Bonita Springs. https:// events.veneziarenaissancefaire.com/.
Artisan Market – Mercato hosts a Hand & Harvest Artisan Market, holiday edition, from noon-4 p.m. in Ste. 3135, across from Z Gallerie & Tommy Bahama. Kids can take photos with Santa while parents shop 35+ local artisans selling a curated collection of handmade items from baked goods to fine art. Bubbles Bar offers mimosas benefiting Empty Bowls Naples. 9110 Strada Place, Naples. 239-254-1080 or experiencemercato.com.
Hey Kids – Live! Science Shows are hosted by the staff at Stemlab at 1:30 p.m. on Saturdays and Sundays at Miromar Outlets, Ste. 192, near WINK Playland. Get lessons on chemistry, aerodynamics and fire. 10801 Corkscrew Road, Estero. 239-948-3766 or www.miromaroutlets.com.

The buffet menu includes chicken paprikash with spaetzle and chef-carved prime rib with dobos torte for dessert. There’s music by Talfi. 3855 Forest Glen Blvd., Naples. Reservations are required by Jan. 19 at 239-821-1814.

Todd accompanies his smooth vocals and guest performers by simultaneously playing six keyboards and on piano. $30. 7775 Vanderbilt Beach Road, Naples. 239-272-0297 or toni@tonitrombley.com.

The Yoga and Yoga Nidra meditation uses gentle movements suitable for all levels welcome. BYO yoga mat, towel, water. A donation of $20 is requested in person or online at www.thepeacefulpresence.com. 27750 Old 41 Road, Bonita Springs. 847-776-8717, 239-949-0749 or www.ShangriLaSprings.com.

Doors open at 5 p.m. Dinner is at 5:30 p.m. and the movie begins at 6:30 p.m. Held every other Monday through March. $20 members; $25 non-members. No experience is needed. $12 at the door. 28285 Imperial Pkwy., Bonita Springs. www.meditationinfortmyers.org.

TUESDAY1.30
Garden Tour – Take an Organic Garden Tour from 10-11 a.m. Tuesdays at Shangri La Springs. Tours are led by Cecelia Morales, the organic garden manager, and include a sensory-based walking tour around the garden’s subtropical, tropical, annual and perennial crops and orchard. Register in advance. $15 per person. Closed-toe shoes, a hat, sunglasses and sunscreen, and a full water bottle are recommended. 27750 Old 41 Road, Bonita Springs. 239-949-0749 or www.ShangriLaSprings.com.
Trolley Tours – Free Trolley Tours with live music are offered from 11 a.m.-2 p.m. Tuesdays through April 23. One-hour narrated tours of Ave Maria, Collier County’s ‘Community of the Year,’ showcase the town and its history. After the tour, view 25+ model homes by premier builders. Free and it includes a trolley bag filled with swag. No reservations required. 239-352-3903 or visit AveMaria.com.

WEDNESDAY1.31
Guided Tours – The Naples Historical Society’s Official Walking Tours of the Naples Historic District have resumed and are offered on select Wednesdays at 9:30 a.m. The 90-minute docent-led tours take guests through the residential neighborhood of beautifully maintained private historic homes, all of which embody unique stories of Naples’ past. Tours begin and end at Historic Palm Cottage at 137 12th Ave. S., Naples. $16 members; $22 non-members. Reservations required. 888-472-1895 or napleshistoricalsociety.org.
Learn Bridge – Bridge declarer play lessons are offered from 9 a.m.-noon Wednesdays at Elks Lodge No. 2010. No partner needed. 11250 Tamiami Trail E., Naples. Register at 239-775-8460 with Marcia.
Chair Yoga – Chair Yoga classes are offered from 1-2 p.m. Wednesdays at the Fleischmann Community Center. A gentle practice of stretching and centering poses done on or next to a chair. 1600 Fleischmann Blvd., Naples. An online chair yoga class is offered from 11 a.m.-noon on Tuesdays. Led by Jean Erlbaum, certified master yoga teacher. 413-230-1518 or jean.erlbaum@verizon.net.
Music Lecture – The History of Ragtime Music, a lecture and presentation, is offered from noon-1:30 p.m. in the Moe Auditorium at Arts Bonita. Peter Bergin speaks. A catered lunch is included. Tickets: $49. Reservations required. 10150 Bonita Beach Road, Bonita Springs. 239-495-8989 or www.artcenterbonita.org.

Nanette Rivera from the Conservancy of Southwest Florida presents this lecture about how the public can advocate for its protection. $10 at the door, free for members. Reservations. 180 S. Heathwood Dr., Marco Island.239-389-6447 or www.themihs.org.

LOOKING AHEAD
Food and Beer – A Food Truck Rally & Pop-up Biergarten takes place from 3-9 p.m. Feb.1-2 and noon-9 p.m. Feb. 3 at Riverside Park. The event is hosted by the Bonita Springs Historical Society. 10451 Old 41 Road, Bonita Springs. $28 or $49 VIP at www.eventbrite.com.
The Ultimate Car Show – The Naples Automotive Experience kicks off with a Jetport Reception from 6-10 p.m. Feb. 1, followed by events at various locations Feb. 2-4. Shelby American reveals the new Shelby Series 2 car, plus exotic cars, jets, planes, helicopters and more are showcased. There’s also a cigar lounge, fine wine tasting, food and music. Reservations required. www.naplesautomotiveexperience.org.
Elvis in Town – World champion tribute artist Ted Torres Martin’s portrayal of The King of Rock N’ Roll is on stage at 6:30 p.m. Feb. 1 at the Rose History Auditorium. He’s called one of the world’s top tributes — a title he earned in Memphis from Elvis Presley Enterprises. Doors open at 6 p.m. $50. 180 S. Heathwood Dr., Marco Island. themihs.org or 239-389-6447.
Al Fresco Concert – Mercato Nights Music Series continues from 6:30-8:30 p.m. Feb. 1 with a performance by Cayman on the event lawn at Mercato. Food and drinks for purchase from the Zza Baby food truck and The Pubs outdoor bar. BYO lawn chairs and blankets. Leashed pets welcomed. 9110 Strada Place, Naples. 239-254-1080 or experiencemercato.com.
Classic Film Screening – Naples Cinematheque presents an outdoor showing of “Trainspotting” from 7-9 p.m. Feb. 1 at The Burrow. The new restoration allows viewers to see all the debauchery in crystal clear color. 1780 Commercial Dr., Naples. $12. www.naplescinematheque.com/events.
Bonita Concert – R Howard and The Incorrigibles present “Total Rock ‘N’ Roll Recall” at 7:30 p.m. Feb. 1 in the Moe Auditorium at Arts Bonita. The show features three well-respected local musicians: Darrell Nutt on drums, Susie Hulcher on bass and vocals, and Ricky Howard on guitar and vocals, joined by the special guest artist Matt Baxley on keyboards and vocals. $35 and $45. 10150 Bonita Beach Road, Bonita Springs. 239-495-8989 or www.artcenterbonita.org.
Seafood Fest – The 2024 Everglades Seafood Festival marks its 54th year Feb. 2-4 in Everglades City. It’s three days of live country music, carnival rides, arts, crafts and seafood. Headliner Lonestar performs at 8 p.m. Saturday. 102 Copeland Ave. N., Everglades City. evergladesseafoodfestival.org/.
Weekend Unwind – The Estero Historical Society hosts a “First Friday on the Deck” from 4-6 p.m. Feb. 2 at its headquarters. This flavored Vodka Tasting Fundraiser features four flavored vodkas paired with appetizers in a natural environment. $25 members; $30 non-members. 9285 Corkscrew Palms Blvd., Estero. RSVP required at EsteroHistoricalSociety.com or 239-272-1911.
Opera Event – “A Toast To Opera: Madama Butterfly” takes place at 4 p.m. Feb. 2 at the Naples Botanical Garden. This is a special opportunity to learn about the opera before it’s performed by the Naples Opera in March. Dr. Tom Cimarusti, Florida Gulf Coast University Professor of Musicology, speaks and answers questions. Wine and light bites follow. $38. Student tickets with ID are available through the box office only. 239-963-9050 or https:// operanaples.org.
Evening in the Garden – The Naples Garden’s Friday After 5 from 5-7 p.m. Feb. 2 features the Naples Opera resident artists performing select arias from “Madama Butterfly” and other well-known works. The Naples Philharmonic Youth Jazz Orchestra also performs, and the Fogg Café stays open with a full menu and bar. 4820 Bayshore Dr., Naples. www.naplesgarden.org or 239-643-7275.
Tribute Show – The Legends Concert Series continues from 6-10 p.m. Feb. 2 with a tribute concert performance of The Cars and Journey on the East Lawn at Paradise Coast Sports Complex. Tickets: $40; $75 platinum and $125 VIP includes two drink tickets and one food ticket. Food and drink for purchase. 3940 City Gate Blvd. N., Naples. 239-252-4386 or https:// playparadisecoast.com. ¦

Proceeds from the Festival benefit the Naples Children & Education Foundation. 2600 Tiburon Blvd., Naples. 239-514-2239 or email Lisa Juliano at lisa@napleswinefestival.com.

Each guest can have three items appraised with a donation of $20 per item to the EHS. Members save $5. 9285 Corkscrew Palms Blvd., Estero. Online registration is required for appraisals at https:// esterohistoricalsociety.com.
